page.title: 01Turnditch and Vicinity
page.content: The parish of Turnditch forms the central part of our area, with Windley, Shottle and Postern , and Hulland Ward accounting for most of the remaining area. Apart from farms, the majority of the housing lies adjacent to the roads although there is a higher density of housing to be found in the centres represented by{Turnditch,Windley,Cross {o' th' Hands, Cowers Lane, Hillcliff {Lane and Shottlegate. } The area is generally shaped by the River Ecclesbourne valley as it emerges from the foothills of the Pennines. By far the greater part of this vicinity is pasture for dairy cattle although there is more by way of arable farming in the river valley. The road pattern is fixed by the A517,the B5023 and the old road from Derby north through Cross o' th'Hands.
